frame.name: Reading_aloud
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> interprets a written <fen>Text</fen> and speaks the contents as <fen>Speech</fen>, usually to an <fen>Addressee</fen>. The contents of the speech may be the <fen>Text</fen> verbatim or a representation of the text. Because the contents of the <fen>Text</fen> are reproduced as the <fen>Speech</fen>, often only one or the other is expressed.
<ex></ex>
<asf>ASFALDA French FrameNet comment</asf>: (TODO : should be renamed FR_Reading_aloud) . Modified version of the Reading_aloud frame. Judgment, Manner, Part_of_speech FEs are removed.
</def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The person or people to whom the Speaker is directing his message.</def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The language user who reads the Text aloud.</def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition: <def-root>A piece of writing, the source from which the Speaker reads.</def-root>

FE.name: Speech
FE.definition: <def-root>The vocalized sound sequence that the Speaker produces from interpretation of the Text.</def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The medium from which the Text is read.</def-root>
